summary: Simon talks regional pricing
mainText: 'Could not do regional pricing in time for early access, so I decided "f it, let's just drop the price of the game as a whole for everyone and hope for the best"'

summary: Simon gives notes and thoughts on pricing.
mainText:
'I‚Äôm pricing Hytale as aggressively low as possible. I‚Äôm taking on a considerable personal risk after repurchasing the game and getting it ready for early access for a growing team of now 50 talented individuals. I said I was all in, and I am delivering on that promise.

The game is unfinished and runs on a build from over four years ago. Charging more didn‚Äôt feel right. I don‚Äôt think the game is good yet. My team and I will push hard to make it good, then great. The vision is clear and progress is fast.

I want as many players as possible to jump in. Times are tough in the current economy for a lot of you, and I want everyone to have a fair chance to be part of what comes next.

Thank you for the support.'

summary: Slikey explains singleplayer mods
mainText: ' I'll prep an explanation but since our singleplayer spins up a local server in the background, you select the mods you want and have locally available and it will use these mods for that singleplayer save.'

summary: Hytale tweets image of preorder page, other editions
mainText:
'If you wish to support the team and Hytale‚Äôs development, we will be offering a Supporter and Founders pack that offers cosmetics like capes, hats, and more.'

($19.99, $34.99, $69.99 USD)

summary: Hytale announces starting price.
mainText: 'Hytale will be $19.99 (USD)'

summary: Slikey says they have no plans for relay servers, other options available.
mainText:
'We don't have plans for that at the moment as we want to stay focused on making the game instead of spinning up such infrastructure & billing. We believe there are enough options to let everyone enjoy:
- Singleplayer with uPNP (port-forwarding as fallback)
- Self-Hosted dedicated SMP servers
- Third-party server rental services

The relay would be bandwidth intensive and we wouldn't be able to provide it for free, so server rental services are probably the preferred way anyway as it allows your friends to play when you are not around.'

summary: Controller support in the future
mainText: 'in the future ofc, very important even for some PC players because of accessibility'

summary: Simon responds to complaint about lack of redstone-like systems
mainText:
'Please remember, the game is not good enough yet!
We have many systems and gameplay stuff we need to do to achieve our vision. We do have plans for automations and fun gadgets to expand the creativity of adventure players.
However, right now our focus is on the release and trailer vision!'

summary: Slikey talked about plugins and ping
mainText:
'We have some systems being predicted on the client but there is work to do. I believe there is a future where visual scripts will help us to better tell the client how to predict behavior.
Then again we have a transfer packet with 4KB payload so server networks starting at 2 servers can be globally distributed and avoid high pings in the first place.'

summary: Simon talks about regional pricing
mainText: 'It won‚Äôt be possible at launch but I‚Äôm working hard to lower price of game before announcement today.'

summary: Simon talks about Hytale and Minecraft
mainText:
'Minecraft is one of the greatest game of all time, it has perfected many designs that no one appreciates.
Hytale is going in a very very different path, we are more going into adventure aspects as a core game (with modding in mind). We will not have things like Redstone for example. Magic will be part of Hytale in many aspects, very much so fantasy feeling.

Another thing is, our crafting is moreso like the games like Valheim / Terraria instead of grid crafting. So its very different and allows us to go in a different direction.

I have great respect for the people at Mojang, they have created an amazing game and community, our games will be very different, Minecraft is still one of my favourite game of all time.'

summary: Simon talks about pricing the game in Brazil
mainText: 'Brazil is important community to me, how much should it cost?'

summary: Simon roasts user insulting Hytale's visuals
mainText: 'Don‚Äôt worry we are working on accessibility options for the visually impaired! Thanks for your report'

summary: Thomas talks tips and tutorials for Hytale Artstyle
mainText: 'You're right, and we're thinking about that. Hytale Art team will help creators to get started with Hytale Art style - through documentation and tutorials - the timeline is unclear for now but it will eventually happen üòä'

summary: Simon talks building
mainText:
'Yep, just finished rotations and other cool features.

Polishing up connected/smart block placement and will see what we can record for you guys.'

summary: Simon gives more crafting details.
mainText:
'You haven‚Äôt seen the actual crafting yet. Its more innovative than grid crafting and more intuitive for new players.
You can upgrade the work stations and eventually expand that system into something that grounds the player to build a house or village. You will see it evolve over time and understand :)'

summary: Simon talks today's news.
mainText: 'Today is pricing details and maybe some screenshots or clip'

summary: Simon talks crafting in Hytale
mainText:
'No grid crafting in Hytale, can be easily modded in if someone care about it!

We are aiming to be different and easier when it comes to the action of crafting. The challenges will come from other places. Just making something we love to play ourselves :)'

summary: Simon says release date revealed at end of next week.
mainText:
'End of next week we will decide and announce the precise early access release date.

Apologies if its confusing we are moving fast on multiple fronts and sometimes my tweets are all over the place!'

summary: Simon shares details on Slikey's QnA
mainText: 'Slikey will be on Hytale Discord server chat (Modding / Creative > #discussion) on Saturday, 22nd November 2025 at 12pm EST / 5pm GMT to answer your questions for a full hour and reply to as many questions as possible. Answers will be posted afterwards on the blog if you miss it.'

summary: Propzie posts about the Raptor Mount
mainText: 'The raptor mount helped me find the location quicker for sure, those things are fast!'

summary: Oscar wraps up the thread
mainText: 'And there's the story of how the song came to be in just a matter of days. In this industry you have to be quick on your feet when it matters, and be ready to ROCK at even a moment's notice. And when the call comes you better be armed and ready to do the job.'

summary: Oscar details Pierre Frick's involvement
mainText: 'Finally, the night before release, I begged our UI lead Pierre (@pierre_frick) to record some last minute epic guitar shredding, which he stayed up quite late to finish for meüòÇ(merci beaucoup Pierre mon cherie).'

summary: Oscar gives details on Ozzie's guitars.
mainText: 'Ozzie (@knivesatsea) recorded supporting guitars for me, also with no oversight, acoustic and electric guitars, all mix-ready to drop in. He then spent close to 8 hours mastering the track together with me to get it sounding as professional as it does. A truly epic producer.'

summary: Oscar gives details on Victoria's vocals.
mainText: 'Victoria (http://vbvocalistic.com) did a fantastic job on the vocals, providing backing vocals with a full arrangement, with zero guidance on chords or anything. She gave me 3 takes and extra ad-libs to work with, fx and dry stems (150+ stems). All for a VERY reasonable price!'

summary: Oscar reveals he wrote the song's lyrics a few months ago, produced it within 3 days of Hytale Saved.
mainText:
'I actually wrote the lyrics a few months ago, but when Hytale was suddenly saved I knew I had to produce the song right away, and within 3 days it was done.

I reached out to my good friends and professional colleagues Victoria and Ozzie for production support.'

summary: Oscar starts a thread on "This Is Our Tale" details.
mainText: 'This Is Our Tale' has so far got over 10k streams. Thank you all for listening to the song and leaving so many lovely comments! :) I've read them allüïµüèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è'

summary: Slikey responds to accessibility concerns re: lack of client side mods.
mainText: 'I think this is a very valid concern and we have communication planned regarding accessibility and our commitment to it. We absolutely have work to do and also work with experts that can help us prioritize the work. The first step is making the game accessible. I hope we will be able to move fast here aswell and we have developers highly motivated to work on accessibility. I hope we will have a Hytale that doesn't rely on mods for accessibility.'

summary: Ktar posts example of serverside UI mods
mainText: 'Here's an example of what can easily be done in a few minutes with server side UI modding. In Game vs. UI Markup Asset vs. Java mod code. All work together to create a powerful server-side UI toolkit available at launch in Hytale.'

summary: Lots of UIs are server side
mainText:
'Yes, a lot of our UIs are server-side. Maybe 
@Ktar5 can post an example.'

summary: Slikey jokes about banner art, moving fast
mainText: 'He saved me with this banner art.. I didn't have one 20 minutes before posting and Propzie cooked this up really quick.. We are moving fast hereüòÖ'

summary: Slikey says there is no plan to add ambiguous server modding.
mainText:
'There is currently no such functionality and no plan to add it but we are always open for feedback and the community to tell us that we are dead wrong about it. We want to see how this strategy plays out but any good strategy falls apart when hit with reality :)'

("Will it be possible for servers to be ambiguous about certain types of mods? I expect most servers wouldn't care about something like UI, unless they're going for a very specific experience.")

summary: Slikey says the server is authoritative over mods used, with SP mods not being in MP.
mainText:
'Correct, the server is authoritative over the mods used. Your singleplayer mods are not brought into multiplayer. We try to bring far render distances directly into Hytale. We have people like JellySquid (Sodium author) work on our Renderer to never need such invasive mods.'

("but would there be some just client mods allowed? like minecraft you can join servers that are pretty customized like wynncraft but then add mods to increase render distance, or is just none of your own mods allowed on servers?")

summary: Slikey says post-launch goal is to solve dynamic asset streaming by using caching and CDN redirects
mainText:
'We need to solve this using caching and CDN redirects for asset pack serving. Stuff for post-launch.'

("My biggest question right now is if there's any way of dynamic asset streaming. In Minecraft, when we had a lot of music, we would have to resort to the player connecting to a web browser, because loading a giant resource pack was simply not feasible")

summary: Slikey says the Hytale Asset Editor will be released as part of the game.
mainText: 'Will be released with the game. It is part of the game.'

summary: Slikey says there is no client modding.
mainText: 'The client won't have control. The creative modders behind the server want you to have a certain experience and we want to respect those decisions. If problems arise from that, we can always revisit this.'

mainText: 'I think that is defined in the model using attachment points. I am sure you will be able to see it when you open our models and look for it üëç'

summary: Slikey says there are no plans to support custom shaders or shader mods.
mainText: 'We currently have no plans for custom shader support or shader mods. We are willing to listen though and see what you want to do. We'll find a solution.'

summary: Slikey says he wishes he could remake Warlords minigame in Hytale
mainText: 'I wish I could remake Warlords.. Those particle effects there were fun to make because I love linear algebra but now in Hytale it would be just perfect.'

summary: Slikey discusses using "plain old Java"
mainText: 'It will be plain old Java to make plugins and compile them against our server jars as dependencies.'

summary: Slikey talks about Port Forwarding
mainText: 'I'll dive into that more when I am less sleep deprived but this is usually solved using uPNP which resolves the need for port forwarding on consumer devices. Most game consoles use this and it is usually enabled by default on consumer routers. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_Plug_and_Play'

summary: Slikey says VisualScripting is encouraged but you can use "just Java."
mainText: 'Correct. We'd like to encourage using Visual Scripting as it is more accessible and safe to share and download but you are not forced to use it if you just want to stay in Java.'

summary: Slikey confirms LAN support
mainText: 'As in you can invite friends into your singleplayer world? Yes.'

summary: Slikey says there's a lot of development to catch up on.
mainText: 'Remember it is not there yet. This is the vision, we have a lot of development to catch up on and for now it is Java plugins with Visual Scripting being introduced shortly after launch. Anything you'd be able to do in Visual Scripting is already available in Java today.'

summary: Slikey says SinglePlayer
mainText: 'Yes, the singleplayer spins up a local server so that you can enjoy plugins even in singleplayer. There is no difference between multiplayer and singleplayer.'

summary: Slikey says it is currently java, and Visual Scripting will eventually complement it.
mainText: 'Correct. It is plain old Java right now and we will bring Visual Scripting to complement this.'

summary: Slikey discusses bulletpoint prominence in blogpost
mainText: ' Can't help myself  I love to communicate with the community but writing long texts is not what I tend to enjoy even when the topic is so exciting and close to my heart as modding.'

summary: Slikey talks about the artstyle "rules"
mainText: 'Pretty much yes. Our art team can probably explain it better but we believe some limitations maintain a healthy art style and performance. We dream of an Orbis that has an artstyle the community can achieve and add to so that mods are immersive and seamless.'

summary: Hytale tweets the new blogpost
mainText:
'In this new blog post, Technical Director, Slikey, gives us a transparent and in-depth look of where Hytale modding stands today and its future. #Hytale 
https://hytale.com/news/2025/11/hytale-modding-strategy-and-status
'

summary: Slikey says Hytale will follow UE's approach
mainText: 'Yes. In Unreal Engine you use C++ and Blueprints in tandem - C++ code is used to make more blueprint nodes available. Hytale will follow the same approach and you use Java plugins to make unlock more nodes in our visual scripting.'
